Content: *p73635a0220*2  answer all questions.1 a student investigated heating a liquid using the apparatusshown.thermometerbeakernozzlesteam generatorliquidcontrol tapthe control tap adjusts the rate of flow of steam from the nozzle. the steam heats the liquid in thebeaker.(a) the student used a kitchen thermometer. the thermometer scale is shownbelow.(i) state the resolution of the thermometerinc.(1)(ii) the student heated the liquid. he started a stopwatch and recorded the temperature of the liquid. he recorded the time at fixed intervals of temperature, as the temperatureincreased. explain why this method was better than starting a stopwatch and recording the temperature at fixed intervals oftime.(2)

*p73635a0320*turn over    3  (b)the student repeated the investigation with a different liquid. he started timing at the same initialtemperature.(i) state another control variable that would allow him to compare the specific heat capacities for the twoliquids.(1)(ii) the student plotted a graph of temperature against time for the first liquid, asshown.temperature /c4035302520151050010203040time /s sketch on the graph the line for a liquid with a greater specific heatcapacity.(2)(c) another student performed the investigation using a temperature probe connected to a datalogger.give two reasons why this would improve theinvestigation.(2)(total for question 1 = 8 marks)

*p73635a0420*4  2 two identical pendulums are linked together using a rubber band asshown.stringstand00:00lpendulum bobmetal rodrubber bandstopwatchidentical pendulumsone pendulum is set in motion. the amplitude of oscillation of this pendulum decreases to zero as the rubber band transfers energy to the other pendulum, which oscillates with increasingamplitude.energy is continually transferred between the two pendulums, so their oscillations alternately increase and decrease inamplitude.(a) the time taken for the amplitude of one pendulum to change from zero to a maximum and back to zero again isp.it is suggested that the relationship between p and the vertical distance l between the metal rod and the rubber band isp = a lbwhere a and b are constants.

*p73635a0520*turn over    5  devise a plan to test the validity of this relationship using a graphicalmethod.(6)(b)a student recorded the motion of the pendulums using a videocamera.suggest how this may improve the measurement of p.(2)(total for question 2 = 8 marks)
